alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Western Essex; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 3:45PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen, northwestern Westmoreland, east central Caroline and northwestern Essex Counties through 430 PM EST... At 344 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Newtown, or 8 miles southwest of Champlain, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Colonial Beach, Loretto, Leedstown, Beazley, Hustle, Potomac Beach, Elevon, Oak Grove, Supply, Central Point, Chance, Potomac Mills and Salvia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for north central and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Western Essex; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland
